TopicTitle: Launcher behaves strangely when clicking on "update" (ver. 1.0.4)

Articles.Content:
Hi, I'm using the Launcher.x86_64 on my Linux system and here's what happens:

When I open the launcher it displays "Downloading Patcher..." for a while, after that, three buttons become visible: the cogwheel, "update" and "play".

Clicking on the cogwheel to bring up the settings menu works fine, so does starting the game by clicking on "play".

But when I click on "update", the three buttons are grey'd out, and never become clickable again. The other buttons (social media, KSP store, Mods@Curse) still work. At that point I have no other option, than clicking on the [x] in the upper right corner to close the launcher and start the game either by restarting the launcher and clicking "play", or executing KSP.x86_64 directly.

The "news" box seems to work fine at all times.

I'm unsure if this is due to a few mods I've installed, but I seem to remember that this behavior was present in the un-modded state, too. But because I can't be sure, I decided to post this into the /modded installs/ section.

Is that a known issue?

The launcher is broken, and currently only downloads a html link to the Squad website, this is a known issue.

All I can suggest is you ignore it.
